description:
Hello

We have a requirement to put together an online application process for our Young Games Makers programme - for young people 16-17 who aren't old enough to be full Games Makers.

Attached is a spec for the form - please could you review? We need a cost estimate and time plan. The form would be required for September.

Happy to discuss on the phone but wanted to give you an oversight of the scope first.

Thanks!

Morag

Hi Morag,

Just been looking over this, do you have an idea of [essential] scope / budget?

The reason I ask is on one hand we could slightly shoehorn it to be a basic form, with 2 or 3 extra questions dependent on the role (or url) and a basic CSV export, with all filtering done offline in Excel.

At the other end we could look at building something much nicer and tab based with multiple pages and some backend tools to handle the filtering.

It we we're fulfil all the business requirements to the line, it would probably be more the latter, but obviously with that come increased costs.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? also will the type always be a free text box?
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct?
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system.

In terms of backend screens / reporting it may be easier to talk though this on the phone.

I'm around all day so when ever is good for you, feel free to call.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie!

I am asking my colleague Jessica to provide answers to the questions below as I am on leave this week.

Jess, please can you review the below and send Jamie your thoughts, including budget?

Thank you!

Morag

Hi there

Morag has asked me to respond in her absence and as the original request came from me, it would seem to make sense ;)

I have looked down the email trail below and hope I have pulled out the questions for which you require answers.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? No always just one and two, maybe just one sometime if the sport doesn’t want to add another question. also will the type always be a free text box? Yes
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct? Yes – depending on role you select this determines which questions you get for 1 and/or two but this is the only dependent field.
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system. – no once we are live they will be fixed

Regarding the backend, obviously the easier it is to use the better. My main requirement will be to be able to print off the applications to take to interview (so all the information is easy to read in the interview) and to do analysis to make sure an organisation hasn’t applied more than once for the same role, report on the number of roles they have applied for, look at the number of applications per role. Other solutions we are evaluating are cheap but have quite basic backend functionality e.g. using adobe forms. It would be great if you could cost with a csv backend but also something a bit more sophisticated with tabs.
Do you know how long it will take you to get a view on costs, I am really keen to make a decision by the end of the week as I know we are running short of time.

If it is easier to chat about any of these requirements please do not hesitate to call me on 02032012656.

Thanks
Jess

Speak to you post 5

Enjoy the training :)

Update on this: the client has come back with a query as to the feasibilty of extending the original form somewhat. The suggested revised structure is attached. The basic change is inclusion of a range of personal identification information within each of the two Team Leader sections (involving document ID, addresses, D&I data, emergency contact details). This makes each of those two sections substantially longer. 

Please don't spend too long looking at this but can you advise:
1. Is the additional scope feasible within the timeframe of mid September
2. Cost impact (roughly)

My feeling is that we say no to this request and say we need to stick to the original scope, but I did say I would discuss it with you.

I also have some questions around the layout of this form - are you envisaging it as one form or four pages? Do we need css creating for this? 

Please can we have a quick catch up on this today? I am also planning to hand this over to Kavita to lead on from our end, so would like to get her up to speed on it.

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

That looks like a substantially larger / more complex form than before, more than just extra fields there is also the added project management workload of making sure we have all the relevant values for each drop down and/or reg-ex's for checking the format of certain fields and slightly more extensive testing.

It's probably another 2/3 days development and an extra day of project management (but I haven't looked *that* closely)

As you mention, we were expecting this to live on one page but this size of the (new) form would be more suited to a 4 page, 4 step form with the ability to save at any stage (funnily enough I am having deja-vu re. Ceremonies; in that if from the outset we had knew the form was going to get more complex, much like Ceremonies, we may have suggested a different route / approach; indeed as we have only just started on this piece of work that is still an option; I will discuss internally). 

Much as I don't like to turn work down. I do wonder if (we can't go down the Rails route) it is better to just say no now in order to stem any further feature creep on a piece of work that is already fairly tight on timescale and already a large single page form. The biggest danger / risk / problem with all these data capture projects is flux or creep around the fields that need to be captured (inevitable to some extent, as more people are aware of the project and want the form to capture data pertinent to them, but equally a risk in terms of regression and errors creeping in / deadlines being missed).

That said we haven't gone so far that it would be a massive disruption to add the extra fields at this stage, although I would question whether you can have a form this long on one page without a 'save' option and therefore it may be worth quickly deciding if we would be better off re-scoping the project as a Rails app with a 4 stage / page form, that can be saved at any stage (although lack of lead time - to allow BTS to agree to us using a hosted Rails server - rather than development time is probably the biggest hurdle in a late change in architecture/approach; )

Can I also check the client is OK with this just living on a standard Games maker template, we haven't costed for any kind of complex design work above the standard form layout and page look and feel. We were thinking along the lines of the accessible volunteer form.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

My feeling is that we say ‘no’ to any form amplification, for the reasons of a) time b) added complexity to the form c) the requirement to have to save the form (which I think would be key, given there are two people involved here).

Page design – I think the basic GM form is fine. If we did something more designed we would use a separate budget and could use a separate designer for page layout, but I think the issue is time. I’m assuming there isn’t time to get a third party to do any html production (when would you need it for)?

Morag

Wording for the application form introduction (main landing page) :
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you for choosing to apply to the Young Games Maker programme.  Please ensure that you have read all the information on the website before submitting your application.  You will be asked to apply for a specific role, at a specific venue during either the Olympic or Paralympic Games. The required skills and experience and the size of the team will vary based on the role you are applying for.  You may only make one application per role.

As the primary team leader making this application, please ensure that you have to hand your passport/driving licence and details of your previous address if you have lived at your current address for less than three years.

Once you have submitted this form you will not be able to change your application, if you would like to print a copy of your application, please do so before you press ‘Submit’.  

Please be aware that this application form does not have a time out, so do not leave the form open and visible if completing in a public area as it contains personal data.

If you have any questions, please contact the Games Maker support centre on info@gamesmaker.london2012.com or 0845 402 2012. 

Good luck and thank you for your application.

Hi Kavita, 

I'm not sure whether you recall, but there was a pivotal issue raised about the apostrophes appearing in every field.
The reason the apostrophe was put in there was to address this precise issue (telephone numbers being treated as integers when - in fact - they should be strings). However, the "apostrophe fix" appears (given the issue you raised) not to work in "SharePoint".

I'm afraid I don't have any experience of SharePoint, but I would suggest that it might be an idea to do something approximating:

 1. Select the entire column containing the telephone numbers.
 2. Find the menu item, or control button that that allows you to specify the "display format" (possibly known as "field format").
 3. Select a display format of "text", or "unformatted", or "raw text" / other. Basically you're looking for a format that ISN'T a number type.

The problem incidentally is that spreadsheet software treats fields as numbers by default. This means that the following issues arise when displaying fields containing telephone numbers:
 1. Leading "0"s are omitted (as they're redundant when displaying numbers).
 2. When the field reaches a certain length (i.e. over about 10 digits) numbers get displayed in scientific notation (e.g. 2.5234+E11).
You don't want either of these behaviours for telephone numbers, so you need to tell SharePojnt that these fields are NOT numbers.

If you have any questions, please ask, but bear in mind that I don't have a copy of SharePoint so I can't answer SharePoint-related questions with any authority!

I hope this helps,

Kind regards,

Kieran

subject: 2 requests re: mascot splash template
description:
(Danny, please note an additional request for info, any thoughts on item 1?)

Hi all. Just spoke to Danny about this on the phone, info on first possible date you could do this would be much appreciated. If there's any room to do it on Monday then the news will be particularly welcomed.


1)      We're going to use the 'Mascot splash' template in the london2012.com CMS to aggregate content related to the London 2012 mascots' song that's on sale. Currently the template is hard-coded to pull in the main scrolling banner images from the same place no matter how many times you replicate it on the site. Those images are http://www.london2012.com/images/mascots/mascot1.jpg and http://www.london2012.com/images/mascots/mascot2.jpg .



For the version of the template that currently sits at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/index.php we'd like this to remain the same. However, for the new version of the template that I've created at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php but haven't published yet, we'd like to pull in two different images instead (eg. .../mascot3.jpg and .../mascot4.jpg ?). Can this be altered in the code fairly easily?




2)      We would like the Facebook and Twitter social buttons in the breadcrumb on the new page at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php to act as shares rather than subscriptions. This would mean:


-          changing the Twitter 'follow' button to a 'tweet' button (which pre-populates a tweet linking back to the page). The current link to @London2012 that sits next to the 'follow' button could be replaced by a counter reflecting how many times the new 'tweet' button has been used.



-          Changing the function of the 'Like' button to 'share' of the link on the user's Facebook wall. The counter for this button will need to be reset to reflect the number of times the page has been shared



-          The +1 button can stay the same as it already serves the purpose we want.

subject: Patching Kitsite Webservers
description:
The Current Kitsite VMs that host the London2012 website are running on unpatched RHEL 5.1.

Under guidance from BT we are looking to upgrade these servers to Redhat 5.6 and apply the full set of YUM security patches.

We are looking to do this in staging first - updating Stage03 and 04 and fully testing before moving to the web servers.  When we upgrade the web servers we will be taking each server out of the load balancer, making the changes, testing the box and returning it to the load balanced pool.

We will need Kitsite help and assistance with this to indentify a suitable window for this work to take place, and to be on had in case there are any issues with the patching.

comments.value:
The Current Kitsite VMs that host the London2012 website are running on unpatched RHEL 5.1.

Under guidance from BT we are looking to upgrade these servers to Redhat 5.6 and apply the full set of YUM security patches.

We are looking to do this in staging first - updating Stage03 and 04 and fully testing before moving to the web servers.  When we upgrade the web servers we will be taking each server out of the load balancer, making the changes, testing the box and returning it to the load balanced pool.

We will need Kitsite help and assistance with this to indentify a suitable window for this work to take place, and to be on had in case there are any issues with the patching.

A Redhat upgrade shouldn't affect the web servers, but it would be a good idea to do stage04 first and ensure that it can be accessed directly via port 80/443 so that it can be tested in isolation.

Any problems with stage03 might impact publishing to the live environment, so cannot be recommended without extensive testing first.

Danny - agree that we should do this in that order.

The date that we have for doing this now is Weds 19th October for the staging and Thurs/fri for the production servers.  Hope this date works for you guys.

Russ

Wed 19th is good for staging, although please not my earlier comment: "it would be a good idea to do stage04 first and ensure that it can be accessed directly via port 80/443 so that it can be tested in isolation."

Stage04 cannot as far I know be accessed directly at present, so you may want to raise a CR adding a new sub-domain, stage04.london2012.com, with access from within your network and our IP addresses (which you should already have on file).

We would not recommend applying any patches on Friday, for the usual reasons.

hi danny - we have set up a new subdomain for communicating directly with stage04 - access from Kitiste and Locog.

pickle.london2012.com  can you set up the hostfile to point this at stage04 for us.

Also it is also looking likely that we will not be doing this on the 19th as the eDNS change has slipped which means that we are needing to focus on eDNS next week
We have changed httpd.com on staging and pickle.london2012.com now points to http://pickle.london2012.com/
Or possibly not. Russ, I will get back to you on this one tomorrow.
Hi Danny - this has all been done and pickle.london2012.com seems to work

subject: Kitsite Webhosting Patching today
current_collaborators: Kieran Topping, Lars Bortfeldt, Jamie Unwin
description:
Hi there,

As we discussed with Danny last week  - following the patching of staging we are going to be patching the Web hosting production boxes today to upgrade RHEL 5.1 to RHEL 5.6.

This will begin with Web03 (also known as Web05) from 10.30 - taking it out of the load balancer and patching.

We will then need to be sure that the rsync from web01 to this box works.

If this works then we will be patching web02 and then web01 by similarly taking them out of the load balancer.

When we patch Web01 we will need to ensure that the stage03 to Web01 and web01 to web02-03 rsyncs work - we expect this to be later in the day- about 1800.

Trust that you will be on hand if there are any issues with this.

Russ

subject: Generation of General XML Google sitemap (not incl news/video/photos - these have separate tickets)
description:
General sitemap, a couple things we need to deal with, which make it tricker than just looking though all the page son the site and outputting an XML file.

a) Excluding pages that are in the CMS but aren't normally navigable to. As you say everything that does not have 'hide from navigation' should appear, but it's not quite as simple as we do have pages that are excluded by section for example signup pages and test directories.

Probably the best thing here is for us to create the site map and then have a run though it and see if we can spot any pages that shouldn't be in it.

b) Splitting the files out into multiple files to get round the Google limit of 5000 pages, not an issue per sea but need to do a few queries to work out who to split the site up , probably best if we separate out the sections with large amounts of content, ie. news, images, suppliers and then leave another file with just standard 'content' pages.

Will run some counts of the top sections to work out where to split.

c) Updates, once again not an issue per sea. but we've been discussing internally how best to handle this in the CMS as generating a site map for the whole site each day (or more frequently) is fairly processor heavy.

We can start with a new sitemap generated at say 2am each night.

d) "Virtual hub pages" this is a very interesting one, especially as we're about to relaunch the News section using this format/method. By "Virtual hub pages" I mean hub pages (ie. "Culture News") that don't actually exist in he CMS but are instead created 'on the fly' via a url such as "london2012.com/news?tag=culture" or london2012.com/photos?tag=culture". Currently Google will find these pages via it's crawler, so there is no issue. But once we switch to using a sitemap there seems to be consensus (via a bit of googling) that results from crawling can drop once you are actively serving a site map (I expect Larry Page n isn't even sure and that half of this stuff is old wives tales / speculation).

I think Danny/Kieran have already proposed some work/costs as an extension to the SEO work (copying Danny/Kieran in on this response) to store these urls in the CMS, so that you could link to /news/culture in the CMS but that would actually be mapped to /news?tag=culture. If we did this then we'd have a list of all those 'psudo hub pages' and could export them in the sitemap.

In the immediate term, I assume we'll just have to live without them and hope Google doesn't start to drop the hub pages for given topics (ie. Culture News). In the medium term, if we haven't completed the work above, I guess we could hardcode a sitemap of urls for the key 'pseudo hub pages'.

Jamie

Hi Andy,

First stab at the general site map
http://www.london2012.com/sitemap-general.xml

I am currently excluding these sections, either because we already have site-maps for them, because they should appear in any site-map or because we are planning to create separate sitemap for them to keep the overall size of this 'general' site-map down.

          { section: 'Videos', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Photos', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'News', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Mobile', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Blog', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Press/Media releases', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Events', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Publications', exclude: true, nested: true },   
          { section: 'Get involved/Business Network/ODA Suppliers', exclude: true, nested: true },          
          { section: 'Settings', exclude: true, nested: true },          
          { section: 'Test', exclude: true, nested: true },          
          { section: 'undefined', exclude: true, nested: true },  

 Another question is around <priority> and what you want to do here (it can be set between 0.1 and 1 and is only a indication of the weighting of that page with your site, not how important it is to the rest of the world!)

I have made a rough attempt to automate this, based on section depth and whether the page is an index page, but it's far from fallible, you can see the results in the url above.

We could:

- Add a new field on most pages that let you set an explicit priority (or is this just field proliferation, we already have 20 odd meta data fields)
- We could also hard code priority values for  key sections / pages, but we do need to be sensible here.

Anyway have a look at what we are generate currently, as it's probably a good starting in terms of how to improve it.

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

Is the prioritisation the right way round? I’ve had a scan and it looks a bit like pages higher up in the site have a lower priority – although I’ve just realised that this may be because of SEO URLs making deeper pages look higher than they are.

Apart from that question it all looks fine to me and I don’t think we should add an extra metadata field to control priority – it’d be too much for the team to remember.

Cheers,
Andy
Also, just noticed that the events sitemap you've published has a namespace error. The news one still does too.

Andy,

Do you have a screen grab if the error?

We're using..
<urlset xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9">

and
<urlset xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9"
        xmlns:news="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-news/0.9">
 
For general / events and news respectively.

We originally used, <urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" /> but got the error (see attached screen grab that you sent)
http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=183668

So we then switched it to http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9

I notice that neither http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9 or http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9 return a page.

But http://sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9 without a www does return a directory listing (although no one says to use it that way)

I've just gone though and checked they are all http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9 [as that the url the original error you sendt says Google is expecting]

I'm now a bit confused as Sitemaps and the Google docs says to use http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9 but the Google error message says to use  http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap/0.9 
http://www.sitemaps.org/protocol.php

Be good to see if the new error message is any different.

Jamie
Looks eminently sensible to me – I’ve asked David to review. Will pass on feedback.

Looks like events is expecting the sitemaps.org schema:[cid:image003.jpg@01CC506D.48345BB0]

I think the problem with the news one is that you need a mixture of sitemaps.org and Google. Their examples use:

<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9"
 xmlns:news="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-news/0.9">

They don’t make it easy!

Ah all starting to make sense now, will go and check them off against the spec..

Jamie

Andy,

I know you have loads on :) I'm just doing a bit of Friday housekeeping and realised this ticket is in pending.

a) is there anything in this feed that should be there.
b) are the priorities for the pages wildly out / can you see where we can tweak them and/or would you like to control the priority on a pr page basis (* that would probably be up to a days work as we'd have to add a 'google priority' field to all or a sub-set of templates).

Tom, this is a separate issue and a long-standing one. If you need more feedback on what the issues are, Jamie will be able to give you feedback. 

It you do want us to investigate why particular events are not on the map, it would be helpful if you could give us some examples (although, warning: this may end up being time-consuming).

"Long standing issue" may not be the best wording ;-)

It may have just be that a call wasn't correctly made to Stamen's server from our end, we do try to resend automatically if this happens though so that is a bit odd. It may also be that Stamen failed to call the CMS to retrieve the page correctly (or that by the time they had the page had moved or been renamed). We only keep basic logs so this stuff is hard to debug retrospectively.

I am not entirely sure if Stamen limit the types of pages / the fields on the pages they receive at their end, or treat Events differently, although at the least I think they pick up the title for a page (if it's on the list of page types they except).

The first thing to test is that Stamen are getting sent pages. You can perform a simple test here, this is the url we use to poll Stamen about an page, if you add on the path to an Event after the path= then it should appear on the map 

The URL to call to tell Stamen about a page--->
http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/competing-scarecrows.php

This causes Stamen to make a call back to our server for the XML for the page -->
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/events/competing-scarecrows.php?apiKey=f7AafqNZDa2Vt6NmS.Py3Q

Although not sure the second call back to us happens instantaneously, so if the page has been moved or renamed in the interim the call would fail.

Still investigating, but a couple of questions;

1) Do you have some concrete urls (not saying you making this up, but it's always easier if we are both looking at the same urls / pages).
2) Can I check this is the generic main Stamen map and not a special Events view within the main map?
3) When you say sporadic, is it really sporadic or do you think it's more that no new events are appearing and it's just new stories about events that are appearing? 

I have a recollection (and an in/out box with 200+ emails to/from Stamen whichI am reading though) that we did at one point do something specific re. Events, specifically round dates / type. Although looking at our code we call Stamen in exactly the same way regardless of what kind of page it is. However it is very possible, even likely (esp. if events are treated slightly differently) that Stamen are looking / checking for the existence of a field on an event that no longer exists and are therefore rejecting it.

Who's your most up to date technical contact at Stamen?

It may be worth checking if Stamen handle Events in a special way / checking for special fields? 

For example they should have been sent this event http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/events/competing-scarecrows.php?apiKey=f7AafqNZDa2Vt6NmS.Py3Q so may be worth checking if they would be rejecting it for any reason (assuming it hasn't made it to the map!)


Jamie

Following conversations today – probably best to put this on hold until next week at the earliest.

Hope thats ok,

Apologies!
Closing old tickets
